Data Cube (martini.DataCube)¶

class martini._datacube.DataCube(n_px_x=256, n_px_y=256, n_channels=64, px_size=<Quantity 15. arcsec>, channel_width=<Quantity 4. km / s>, velocity_centre=<Quantity 0. km / s>, ra=<Quantity 0. deg>, dec=<Quantity 0. deg>)[source]¶

Handles creation and management of the data cube itself.

Basic usage simply involves initializing with the parameters listed below. More advanced usage might arise if designing custom classes for other sub- modules, especially beams.

Parameters
n_px_xint

Pixel count along the x (RA) axis. Even integers strongly preferred.

n_px_yint

Pixel count along the y (Dec) axis. Even integers strongly preferred.

n_channelsint

Number of channels along the spectral axis.

px_sizeastropy.units.Quantity, with dimensions of angle

Angular scale of one pixel.

channel_widthastropy.units.Quantity, with dimensions of velocity

Step size along the spectral axis. Must be provided as a velocity.

velocity_centreastropy.units.Quantity, with dimensions of velocity

Velocity of the central channel along the spectral axis.

raastropy.units.Quantity, with dimensions of angle

Right ascension of the cube centroid.

decastropy.units.Quantity, with dimensions of angle

Declination of the cube centroid.

Returns
outDataCube

An appropriately configured DataCube object.

Examples

TODO

add_pad(self, pad)[source]¶

Resize the cube to add a padding region in the spatial direction.

Accurate convolution with a beam requires a cube padded according to the size of the beam kernel (its representation sampled on a grid with the same spacing). The beam class is required to handle defining the size of pad required.

Parameters
padtuple or other sequence of length 2

Number of pixels to add in the x (RA) and y (Dec) directions.

See also

drop_pad
copy(self)[source]¶

Produce a copy of the DataCube.

May be especially useful to create multiple datacubes with differing intermediate steps.

Returns
outDataCube

Copy of the DataCube object.

Examples

TODO

drop_pad(self)[source]¶

Remove the padding added using add_pad.

After convolution, the pad region contains meaningless information and can be discarded.

See also

add_pad
freq_channels(self)[source]¶

Convert spectral axis to frequency units.

spatial_slices(self)[source]¶

Return an iterator over the spatial ‘slices’ of the cube.

Returns
outiterator

Iterator over the spatial ‘slices’ of the cube.

spectra(self)[source]¶

Return an iterator over the spectra (one in each spatial pixel).

Returns
outiterator

Iterator over the spectra (one in each spatial pixel).

velocity_channels(self)[source]¶

Convert spectral axis (back) to velocity units.
